alert.note: Alert for Dade; Greene; Jasper; Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 3:38AM CDT until August 14 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Dade County in southwestern Missouri... Greene County in southwestern Missouri... Jasper County in southwestern Missouri... Northern Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 945 AM CDT Monday. * At 338 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, northern Joplin, Republic, Carthage, Battlefield, Mount Vernon, Strafford, Webb City, Carl Junction, Willard, Oronogo, Carterville, Ash Grove, Jasper, Miller, Alba, Purcell, Everton, Airport Drive, Brookline, Carytown, Asbury, Neck City, Halltown, Avilla, La Russell, Brooklyn Heights, Waco, Chesapeake, Pennsboro, Red Oak, Meinert, Dudenville, Maple Grove, Bois D`arc, Glidewell, Ebenezer, Galloway, Turners and Opolis. This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson Creek at Farm Road 156, Clear Creek at Farm Road 87, Sac River at County Road 1247, Turnback Creek at County Road 2100, Sinking Creek at County Road 181, Dry Fork at Pine Road and Wilson Creek at Farm Road 146. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
